flavor: To the ends of the earth, and back.

back_text: Search all set-aside cards and the victory display for the Royal Emissary enemy, and spawn it in the Theater.
flavor: The theatre is eerily silent. The old wooden floor creaks beneath your feet, and a light rain gently patters on the roof as you explore the auditorium. There are more rotting corpses among the seats, and the rest of the crowd has vanished…

back_text: Each investigator takes 100 horror.
flavor: The creature’s song echoes relentlessly throughout the halls of the theatre. The melody repeats again and again, yet somehow, never the same note twice.
name: Encore

Choose one of the set-aside locations, at random. Put that location into play, and spawn the set-aside The Man in the Pallid Mask enemy at that location .
Advance to one of the 3 copies of act 2a, at random. Remove the other 2 copies of act 2a from the game without looking at them.
flavor: You pinch yourself to see if you are dreaming, and sure enough, your skin stings and reddens. You take a few deep breaths and try to think rationally. Whatever is going on, you must explore the theatre to learn the truth of the matter.

flavor: The mysterious Stranger from The King in Yellow might know something about what happened during the intermission. You must find and confront him if you are to discover the truth.

flavor: The Stranger must know the way out. You have to follow him!
name: Curtain Call

flavor: Must have been one hell of an intermission.
name: Theatre

flavor: Through the tall glass doors leading into the lobby, you can see that this room isn’t nearly as dilapidated as the auditorium. Signs promoting The King in Yellow taunt you from inside.
name: Lobby
text: Forced - When Lobby is revealed: Put 2 of the set-aside Lobby Doorway locations into play, at random. [action] [action]: Draw 3 cards.

flavor: A carpeted staircase leads up into the balcony. Somehow, a hot draft is blowing down through the steep passageway.
name: Balcony
text: Forced - After you perform a move action during which you move from the Balcony to the Theatre: Take 2 damage. Victory 1.

flavor: The set is different from what you remember of the play’s first act, decorated with a backdrop of an unsettling sunset.

flavor: “Indeed it’s time. We have all laid aside disguise but you.” – Robert W. Chambers, “The Mask,” The King in Yellow
name: The Man in the Pallid Mask
text: Spawn - Location farthest from all investigators. Aloof. [action]: Investigate. Your location gets +2 shroud for this investigation. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, defeat The Man in the Pallid Mask.

name: Royal Emissary
text: Prey - Lowest [willpower]. Massive. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator at Royal Emissary's location or a connecting location takes 1 horror.

back_text: [skull]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on the Lunatic enemy in play with the most remaining health. [cultist]: -3. Place 1 of your clues on your location. [tablet]: -4. Take 1 horror. [elder_thing]: -X. X is the shroud value of your location. If you fail, take 1 damage.
name: The Last King
text: [skull]: Reveal another token. If you fail, place 1 doom on a Lunatic enemy in play. [cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location. [tablet]: -4. If you fail, take 1 horror. [elder_thing]: -X. X is the shroud value of your location.

back_text: Find the Bystander asset with the fewest clues on it. Spawn the set-aside Dianne Devine enemy at that asset's location. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
flavor: As you pull up to the manor, you notice that something is wrong. A trail of blood leads up the porch steps, and the front door is smashed. Muted music comes from within the house, its warped and discordant notes painful to your ears. Has the madness of The King in Yellow already made its way here?
name: Fashionably Late

flavor: More and more, this place continues to fall into madness, transforming before your very eyes…
name: The Terrifying Truth
text: Forced - When this agenda would advance by reaching its doom threshold: Instead, remove all doom in play and randomly resolve one of the Sickening Reality cards underneath the scenario reference card. If there are no cards underneath the scenario reference card, advance to agenda 2b instead.

back_text:
Madness. mad·ness. \ˈmad-nəs\
The state of being mentally ill, especially severely.
- Extremely foolish behavior.
- A state of frenzied or chaotic activity.
- Why are you looking at this side?
- There is no reason to flip to Act 1b.
- Flip back to Act 1a.
flavor: This isn’t a party: it’s a mad house. But for some reason, the guests are too deluded to notice. Very few of them are sane, and many are themselves horrors to your eye. Perhaps you can talk to them to learn more about The King in Yellow.
name: Discovering the Truth
text: Forced - When an investigator is eliminated : Place each of that investigator's clues on this act, instead of placing them at his or her location. Objective - Find as many clues as you can, then get out of this awful place!

back_text:
Hunter.
While Constance Dumaine is exhausted, she gets +3 fight.
flavor: Constance laughs as the skin begins to slough off her body. Blood trickles from her shedding skin, leaving a trail of crimson on the carpet where she walks. One might expect her to cease functioning with her ribs and organs exposed, but she barely seems to notice.
name: Sickening Reality
text: Each investigator at Constance Dumaine's location takes 1 horror. Move each clue from Constance Dumaine to her location. Flip this card to its enemy side, and switch it with the Bystander asset version of Constance Dumaine, removing that version from the game.

back_text: Hunter. Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase: Heal 1 damage from Jordan Perry.
flavor: Mr. Perry takes another puff from his cigar, and his eyes burn a deep red hue. As he exhales, his skin begins to crack and hardens into stone. Cigar smoke exudes from the fissures in his skin, and the temperature in the room rises dramatically. He clenches his hand around the chair’s armrest, which crumbles to ash in his awful grasp.
name: Sickening Reality
text: Each investigator at Jordan Perry's location takes 1 horror. Move each clue from Jordan Perry to his location. Flip this card to its enemy side, and switch it with the Bystander asset version of Jordan Perry, removing that version from the game.

back_text: Hunter. Forced - After you deal damage to Ishimaru Haruko by an effect other than an attack: Draw the top card of the encounter deck.
flavor: A nearby guest asks Haruko if she designed the dress she is wearing, and she nods and poses for him. As if part of her effort to appear taller, her spine grows and extends upward, separating her torso from the bottom half of her body. Instead of crying out in pain, she smiles at the attention she receives.
name: Sickening Reality
text: Each investigator at Ishimaru Haruko's location takes 1 horror Move each clue from Ishimaru Haruko to her location. Flip this card to its enemy side, and switch it with the Bystander asset version of Ishimaru Haruko, removing that version from the game.

back_text:
Hunter. Retaliate.
Sebastien Moreau's attacks cannot be canceled.
flavor: Sebastien’s passionate debate with another guest turns ugly. His temper transforms not just his demeanor but his body as well. Thick fur sprouts from his skin, along with several bulbous growths that leak pus and blood. His suit tears as his body distorts, bones snapping and muscles bulging. He is as much beast as he is man.
name: Sickening Reality
text: Each investigator at Sebastien Moreau's location takes 1 horror. Move each clue from Sebastien Moreau to his location. Flip this card to its enemy side, and switch it with the Bystander asset version of Sebastien Moreau, removing that version from the game.

back_text:
Hunter.
Each investigator at Ashleigh Clarke's location does not draw cards during the upkeep phase.
flavor: “Encore! Encore!” the crowd shouts as Ashleigh finishes her final song of the night. Deciding to stay for one last number, she nods to the pianist. The song that follows is excruciating. Her once-beautiful voice is now a wailing screech with unnatural pitch. Her skin has tightened hideously around her bones, and insects begin to eat their way out of her arms and shoulders, crawling over her body. The crowd is loving this final performance.
name: Sickening Reality
text: Each investigator at Ashleigh Clarke's location takes 1 horror. Move each clue from Ashleigh Clarke to her location. Flip this card to its enemy side, and switch it with the Bystander asset version of Ashleigh Clarke, removing that version from the game.

flavor: The entrance hall is lavishly decorated, displaying the wealth of the manor’s owners while still creating a welcoming atmosphere. “Shall I take your coat?” the doorman asks as you enter. It takes a moment before you realize the doorman has only bloody stumps where he should have hands.
name: Foyer
text: [action]: Resign. Having found valuable information about the production, you depart and plan your next move.

flavor: The distorted music grows louder as you approach the ballroom. Inside, many of the guests are dancing, eating, and enjoying themselves.
name: Ballroom
text: [reaction] After you perform a parley action in the Ballroom: Gain 2 resources. (Group limit once per phase.)

flavor: Cigarette smoke and the sounds of idle chatter drift out of the manor’s living room. You feel warmth behind the door.
name: Living Room
text: [reaction] After you perform a parley action in the Living Room: Draw 1 card. (Group limit once per phase.)

flavor: The sounds of conversation and warped music become muffled as you approach a lonely section of the manor. Leading to the door of the gallery is a long hall adorned with many expensive paintings, including one of Mrs. Dumaine herself.
name: Gallery
text: Forced - After you end your turn at the Gallery: Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, place 1 of your clues on the Gallery.

flavor: Looking out one of the windows, you spy the courtyard in the center of the manor. You find yourself longing for fresh air.
name: Courtyard
text: Forced - After you enter the Courtyard: Discard the top card of the encounter deck. If that card is an enemy, draw it.

flavor: The rancid smell of rotten food wafts under the dining room door, and you barely avoid losing your lunch.
name: Dining Room
text: [action]: Heal 1 horror. Then, reveal a random token from the chaos bag. If a [skull] or [auto-fail] symbol is revealed, take 1 horror and place 1 doom on the Dining Room.

back_text: Remember that you "interviewed Constance." Flip this card back over to its Bystander asset side.
flavor: “Can I offer you a glass of champagne?”

text: [action]: Parley. Test [intellect] (3) to ask Constance about the play. If you succeed, take control of 1 of the clues on Constance Dumaine. Forced - When the last clue is removed from Constance Dumaine: Flip this card over and resolve its text.

back_text: Remember that you "interviewed Jordan." Flip this card back over to its Bystander asset side.
flavor: Time is money, and Mr. Perry has all the time in the world.

flavor: You don’t want to arouse suspicion, but you really don’t want to eat that.
name: Fine Dining
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either place 1 of your clues on a Bystander asset in play or take 1 horror and 1 damage.

text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Whispers in Your Head (Dismay) to your hand. You cannot commit skill cards to skill tests. [action] [action]: Discard Whispers in Your Head (Dismay) from your hand.

text: Peril. Hidden. Revelation - Secretly add Whispers in Your Head (Dread) to your hand. You cannot move more than once each turn. [action] [action]: Discard Whispers in Your Head (Dread) from your hand.

flavor: She froze, and her throat clenched. Her eyes began to water. Her vision spiraled and blurred. Then, at long last, she finally understood.
name: Descent into Madness
text: Surge. Revelation - If you have at least 3 horror on you, lose 1 action.

name: Swift Byakhee
text: Prey - Lowest remaining sanity. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When Swift Byakhee would move via the hunter keyword: Instead, move it (one location at a time) until it enters its prey's location. If it moved more than one location by this effect, it does not attack this phase.

name: Hunted by Byakhee
text: Revelation - Test [agility] (6). If you fail, reveal the top X cards of the encounter deck, where X is the amount you failed by. If at least 1 Byakhee enemy is revealed by this effect, choose and draw 1 of them. If at least 1 Omen treachery is revealed by this effect, take 1 horror. Shuffle the encounter deck.

name: Beast of Aldebaran
text:
Massive.
While assigning damage and horror from Beast of Aldebaran's attack, you must assign as much damage/horror as possible to a single card before assigning it to another card.

name: Spawn of Hali
text: Prey - Most horror. Retaliate. Forced - After you successfully evade Spawn of Hali by 2 or less: Take 1 horror.

flavor: It blotted out entire galaxies within its dark shape.
name: Black Stars Rise
text: Revelation - Test [intellect] (4). If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda or take 1 horror for each point you failed by. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance.

name: Spires of Carcosa
text: Revelation - Attach to your location, then place 2 doom on that location. If there is no doom on attached location, discard Spires of Carcosa. [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues here, remove 1 doom from attached location.

text: Revelation - If there is no doom in play, Twisted to His Will gains surge. Otherwise, test [willpower] (X), where X is the amount of doom in play. If you fail, discard 2 cards from your hand at random.

name: Poltergeist
text: Cannot be damaged except by Spell, Relic, or encounter cards. [action] Parley. Test [intellect] (3) to attempt to banish the geist. If you succeed, deal it 1 damage.

name: Spirit's Torment
text: Revelation - Attach to your location. Forced - After you leave attached location: You must either take 1 horror or lose 1 action. [action] Place 1 of your clues on attached location: Discard Spirit's Torment.

flavor: “Get out! Get out! Get out of my head!”
name: Maniac
text: Forced - After Maniac engages you: Take 1 damage and deal 1 damage to Maniac.

flavor: Her eyes widened, and she picked up the knife.

name: Agent of the King
text: Prey - Most clues. Hunter. Forced - After Agent of the King attacks you: Move 1 of your clues to Agent of the King. Forced - When you defeat Agent of the King: Take control of all of its clues.

name: The King's Edict
text: Revelation - For each Cultist enemy in play, move 1 clue from that enemy's location to that enemy. Until the end of the round, each Cultist enemy in play gets +1 fight for each clue and/or doom on it. If no clues are moved by this effect, The King's Edict gains surge.

name: Ooze and Filth
text: Revelation - Put Ooze and Filth into play next to the act deck. Each location gets +1 shroud. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Ooze and Filth.

flavor: You suddenly drop the object on the ground and watch as it erodes and turns to dust before your eyes.

text: Revelation - Discard Item assets from play and/or from your hand with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the shroud value of your location. If no cards are discarded by this effect, Corrosion gains surge.

flavor: A mass of skittering roaches completely covers the floor, leaving a trail of sticky brown ooze in its wake.
name: Roach Swarm
text: X is the shroud value of Roach Swarm's location.

name: Marked by the Sign
text: Peril. Revelation - Test [willpower] (2). If you fail, take 2 horror. If The Man in the Pallid Mask is in play, horror dealt by this effect is considered direct horror, and this test has +2 difficulty.

name: The Pale Mask Beckons
text: Revelation - If The Man in the Pallid Mask is in play, he attacks each investigator in player order, regardless of his current location. If The Man in the Pallid Mask is not in play, search his bearer's deck and discard pile for him, draw him, and shuffle his bearer's deck
